content: hey fellow DM crafters Dan Scotty here
with another cool craft today today we're gonna do some sickly dead trees
right and I needed some of these for my straw game and I won this I wanted the
easy way to do it and I discovered this way that was super easy to make these
very little you have to do to get a really great result so let's at the
table and I'll show you how I made these easy just dead sickly looking trees and
let's hit it see you at the table alright crafters
this is my base material this bear branch stem by Ashland and you get these
at all the big craft stores they're about eight or nine bucks both a coupon
you can get about half off of that so very nice and look at all these branches
make great you know dead trees right and just pre-made basically and I like the
fact that they're a little flexible so they're you know not not like wire where
they you know you hit them and they knock over or they poke you right
they're a little bit flexible so now I need to get these to stand upright so
what I'm gonna do is I'm gonna use my washer I always have extra washers in my
workspace and I always keep various sizes and they take hot glue very well
actually and they're great for weights so I'm gonna just glue that fill it in
like ground right and I put a little dab of glue in the center just stuck right
to my cutting board it'll just pull right off my little trick for adding hot
glue I love this glue gun you can get at the description below in the underneath
the video at the link and what I'm gonna zoom zoom pull hot glue up onto the tree
and that will blend it into the base as well as make the bond very strong right
so just add some more and pull it up you want a nice strong bond it also makes it
look a little bit like a tree on the bottom where it's wider at the bottom
well okay that's not heavy enough to hold the tree up unfortunately so
another washer to the rescue just glue another heavier one on the
bottom and problem solved and I love this glue gun with the full small nozzle
here perfect alright just fill in the edges there make it look like ground and
I'm good to go I'm also gonna add some hot glue on the branches they're a
little smooth I want to kind of roughing them up a little bit you know make it
look more like you know a gnarly tree so I'm just gonna a little bit of hot glue
drag it out on the branches and that'll just add some texture some interesting
texture alright nice now I'm going to add some stuff to the base I got this
aggregate it's fish tank pebbles right I'm just gonna add some of those to the
base just sprinkle them on with my white glue my glue all and the excess put back
and I'm done with that I'll just dump my construction sand on there which is
different sized aggregate last but not least I want to put some pencil shavings
on there is dead foliage or as dead you know plants right so I'll just put those
on the base and then after dry spray it flat black with my flat black spray
paint and I'll paint it with my dark brown so just fill it in this is just
acrylic craft paint and then I'm gonna use a lighter brown for the base and
then paint the dead the dead pencil shavings on there which are you know
supposed to be like dead plants kind of a tannish color and then the tree I'm
painting this kind of sickly Mississippi mud color that I have I really like this
color it's kind of a nasty brown there we go now here's some cotton from my
medicine but you could use cotton balls or anything like this
so I'm gonna make them you know take old pieces off and then 50% water 50% white
glue soak them in that okay kind of get them all you know
soaked enough to glue there all right now I'm gonna use this a green here and
just kind of paint them it's just a kind of a olive green here and just even
while they're wet with the glue just paint them look kind of like slugs now
alright here's my tree and I'm going to add some moss I thought it'd be kind of
cool to have some moss as they're just kind of you know not that interesting
the dead trees aren't that interesting but I thought the moss might make it a
little more interesting so I'm just going to kind of drag that down pull it
down and wow that really adds a lot to the tree actually but still looks like a
dead tree here's another version so another bigger one so really cool really
cool I really like that now I'm going to add some highlight after it dries and
just a little bit of a lighter green after a dried darker and there we go
let's hit the table yeah say guys I thought I'd show you this gate Saburo
via board I set up and it's just my poster board with my stamp technique on

base there and I got these little foliage stands I did and here's the

that Moss really gives a creepy look but a nice little detail from just the brown
looked you know it gives it some little extra they're really nice as you go down

got some 3d printed stuff here I got the statues and the gates in the module the

another 3d printed piece I did so pretty cool and here's a bones gargoyle or
harpy as a decoration on the wall and some detail on the statues there the

added some weathering to it weathering to the gate put it between my
dungeon blocks and it's a perfect gate so we had a really nice fight here a
bunch of wolves came out of the forest from the edge of the board and they had
to fight some of the people who got on the other side and it was a pretty
interesting encounter to say the least so and then I had a crow show up you
know and kind of squawk one-word warnings to them which was kind of fun
and got them thinking about what that could have to do with the module so
there you go I hope you like this and the trees really fit into my straw game
and I hope you like to look at my straw board here you guys take care and happy
